subject: Re: Trueline Website – Updates & Next Steps
preview: Ava confirmed I can close, but monitoring it closely just incase support needs to step in

full_threads.body: Ava confirmed I can close, but monitoring it closely just incase support needs to step in

action.text: Workflow **Assign Expert Plan (AC - Apr 16)** was triggered
Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Hi Mitch and Grant,

Hope you had a great break.

Our team is updating the final items now and the website is in a good position to launch this month and start adding value.

Do you have time Monday or Tuesday at 10am or 4pm to talk through remaining items and finalisation steps?

Thanks,
Andy

On Wed, Dec 17, 2025 at 12:55 PM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Thanks Mitch,

I'm glad you and Shane are catching up on the review now.

We fully agree: accuracy is crucial, especially with the images and consistency across pages.

We will immediately start fixing all the image mismatches (Pergola/Carport, Pallas/Heritage, etc.), button wording, and carousel consistency you flagged.

Please continue to share any other feedback.

Thanks again and happy holidays!

Cheers,
Andy

****

On Tue, Dec 16, 2025 at 3:10 PM Mitch Day <Mitchd@trueline.net.au> wrote:
Hi Andy,

I've been away since the 4th, so we've just been catching up on this now.

Shane is going through it as well and I think asked for access to the site map.

There is a lot of pages where the images don't line up with the existing site, eg: Pergola page has pictures of Carports, Pallas has pictures of Heritage etc.

There is also some wording of some buttons and inclusions of carousels and consistency around these when navigating through the product pages.

We didn't do this thoroughly enough last time we launched a new site and it came back to bite us, so we will need to go through each page to ensure its accuracy.

We will update you with changes as we go through each set - Patios, carports etc.

If we don't speak again before the break, I hope you have a great Xmas and holiday period.

Mitch Day

General Manager

0400 648 249

Just checking in before the holiday break to see if you've had a chance to review the staging website we sent through on December 5th.
👉 https://trueline.wolfiq.cloud/

Our last day for 2025 is Friday, December 19th, and we'll be back on Monday, January 5th, 2026.

Thanks,
Andy

On Thu, Sep 11, 2025 at 3:15 AM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Mitch,

Thanks for the questions - glad to hear the quote looks good.

I've put answers to each question below. Let us know if there's anything else you'd like to confirm.

The proposal is here [Link] and we'll get underway with the remaining designs once confirmed (and share for your feedback).

Thanks again,
Andy

****
  1. Bug Fixes Post-Launch
    • Yes, absolutely. We'll fix any bugs that come up after launch - no extra cost. We also run a full QA process before go-live to minimise any surprises.
    • Fixes or updates are also included on your current plans with us.
  2. Blog / Post Templates
    • The templates are designed to be flexible, so you can easily add new categories or expand content later.
    • If you're planning anything more complex, just flag it early and we'll make sure it's set up the right way.
  3. Design Rounds
    • You'll have up to 3 rounds of design changes included in the quote.
    • We find that's typically more than enough, especially if we start with clear examples or inspiration.
  4. Speed & Mobile Performance
    • Yes - we'll build the site to meet Google's standards for speed and mobile usability (Core Web Vitals), so it performs well out of the gate.
  5. Ownership & Access
    • You'll have full ownership and admin access to everything - WordPress, hosting, and analytics. Just let us know the best email address for access and we'll get those invites sent through.
****

On Tue, Sep 9, 2025 at 9:04 PM Mitch Day <Mitchd@trueline.net.au> wrote:

Hi Andy,

Thanks for organising the quote and it's looking good. Just a few questions:

  • After the site goes live, do you include a support period for fixing any bugs? If so, how long is it?
  • Will the blog/post templates be flexible enough if we want to add new categories or expand later?
  • How many rounds of design changes are included in the price before extra charges apply?
  • Will the site be built to meet Google's standards for speed and mobile usability (Core Web Vitals)?
  • Will we have full ownership and admin access to WordPress, hosting, and analytics once the site is finished?

Appreciate your help with this.

Regards,

Mitch

From: Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au>

Subject: Re: Trueline Website - Updates & Next Steps


Hi Grant and Mitch,

Hope you had a good rest of your week.

We've paused the marketing retainer for now. There were ~$2k of unusage for the rest of this billing month which have been added as credits on Trueline's account for other services.

On the website refresh, I discussed with Heath around options and the site has grown substantially since we last spec'd it out in 2022 for $18k (attached).


The largest body of work is in the unique core pages:

  1. 30 unique core pagers - these would be custom designed
  2. 19 post pages - we'd create a template that house and adapt to these
  3. 133 case study pages - we'd create a template that house and adapt to these
  4. 4 location pages - we'd create a template that house and adapt to these

Outside of the page design, there is projectment management, design, QA and migration work to be done.


That said, presuming we could consolidate core pages down to ~15 pages, we would be able to get the entire rebuild done for $15k. It would take ~6 weeks to be done in time for summer.


This would be a high-impact update that builds on your existing site content while supporting your current resource bandwidth.


Let me know if you'd like to run through anything, or if you would like me to send a formal proposal to confirm the paperwork.

Thanks again,
Andy

Hi Grant and Mitch,


Hope you had a good weekend.


Three things for you below. Are you free on Wednesday at 10am to talk through?


Thanks,

Andy


*******


#1. Location Pages Update


Confirming four patio location pags are now live here

  1. https://trueline.net.au/patio/melbourne
  2. https://trueline.net.au/patio/brisbane
  3. https://trueline.net.au/patio/rockhampton
  4. https://trueline.net.au/patio/sunshine-coast

The only thing missing is Gladstone which we need to confirm

  1. Is there a dedicated email (like brisbane@trueline.com.au, sunshinecoast@trueline.net.au)?
  2. Any completed Gladstone projects we can feature (images/case studies)?

#2. Scaling Back Options


On 'options for scaling back for 2-3 months', here's what we could do to keep digital growth momentum:


A. Location Page Build Out (as planned)

  • Now we have the template built (for patios)
  • We can continue for the remaining product types (carport, pergola, veranda)
  • We should be able to get these all live within the next 30 days
  • This would key for building more organic leads in those markets and catching up to lifestyle patios and others

B. Website redesign

  • As you know, we have been adding a raft of new content and refining existing content on the website.
  • It's performing well and generating a steady flow of leads but a better representation of the Trueline brand and previous work will hold us in good stead to convert more visitors into leads and more leads into clients.
  • We want to pull back on the reds, and move towards a vibe that allows the photos to really shine.
  • I had out team do a quick homepage concept below if helpful to see
  • If this is an option, we would use 3 months of the SEO retainer ($10k) to go towards this project and ask you to 'top up' the rest as needed (~$25k), so the total budget would be ~$35k for the redesign and rebuild.

Trueline | Homepage Redesign - Watch Video
